item.title: Taints
item.description: Why we need Taints ? Just like labels , one or more taints can be applied to a node; this marks that the node should not accept any pods that do not tolerate the taints $ kubectl taint node k8s-master-ah-01 node-role.kubernetes.io/master="":NoScheduleFormat key=value:Effect Effects NoSchedule - Pods will not be schedules PreferNoSchedule- This is a “preference” or “soft” version of NoSchedule – the system will try to avoid placing a pod that does not tolerate the taint on the node, but it is not required.

item.title: Tolerations
item.description: Why we need Tolerations ? Tolerations can be specified on Pods Based on the taints on the nodes , Pods will scheduler will allow to run the Pod on the node. Toleration syntax in Pod spec. spec: tolerations: - key: node-role.kubernetes.io/master effect: NoSchedule
